‚ÄúYou can complain all you want, but you need to bring solutions.‚Äù

Shelja began this work to help take care of others and help connect people through educational and cultural community programs. She realized the need was even greater than just her community, so she expanded.

Shelja has helped bring new and diverse programming into the community, including an annual Diwali celebration, Juneteenth events, and recently a black author showcase in Burlington County and surrounding areas. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/FuV7rAtXoAMpERG.jpg

For Shelja, it all begins with conversations that can grow into change.

Whether it‚Äôs a difficult conversation or helping neighbors work together to solve problems, her goal in the end is to bring people together and find ways to uplift one another.

Her goal is to help fill in gaps so people know where to go for assistance and nobody‚Äôs voice is left behind.

From getting someone a full meal to delivering books to local schools, Shelja tries to find immediate solutions while also working on bigger picture goals. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/FuV7qLjWYAMQJ5i.jpg

Like her fellow volunteers, Shelja uses her professional background and individual experiences to guide her volunteer work.
